intro: Sebastiania oleoides, commonly known as the golden wax tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of yellow-orange flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its sap is thick and sticky, often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. The fruit produces a small, fleshy, orange berry that contains a single seed.
